Trilinos/Zoltan2: Dynamic Partitioning, Matrix Ordering and Graph Coloring Package

Version 0.5

Introduction to Zoltan2

This document is a work in progress.

Overview of Zoltan2

The workflow for a Zoltan2 problem is illustrated below:

A Zoltan algorithm is presented with an objective, for example partitioning objects in order to balance a workload. In addition, algorithm parameters and a candidate solution may provided. The algorithm calculates a solution for the objective. These Objective and the Result correspond to classes in Zoltan2, and the algorithms are the Zoltan methods.

void rcb(Objective<Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID> &o, Teuchos::ParameterList &p, Result<LNO, GNO> &r)

Evaluating the quality of a Zoltan result

The workflow for evaluating a result for an objective is illustrated here:

void evaluate(Objective<Scalar, LNO, GNO, AppGID> &o, Result<LNO, GNO> &r)
